title: Youdao IPO prices at $17 a share, as company raises $220.2 million
text: Youdao Inc. said Friday its initial public offering of 5.6 million American depositary shares priced at $17 a share, as the China-based education technologies company raised $95.2 million. The IPO priced within the expected range of $15 to $18 a share. The company is also raising another $125 million through the private placement of 7.35 million ordinary shares, to funds managed by Orbis Investment Management Ltd., for a total raise of $220.2 million. The joint bookrunners of the IPO are Citigroup Global Markets, Morgan Stanley and Credit Suisse. Youdao is going public at a time the Renaissance IPO ETF has lost 13.0% over the past three months, while the S&P 500 has edged up 0.2%.
